bayou.html

Class HtmlElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.html.HtmlElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HtmlPiece
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Html4.AREA, Html4.BASE, Html4.BR, Html4.COL, Html4.HR, Html4.IMG, Html4.INPUT, Html4.LINK, Html4.META, Html4.PARAM, Html5.EMBED, Html5.KEYGEN, Html5.MENUITEM, Html5.SOURCE, Html5.TRACK, Html5.WBR, HtmlParentElement

    public abstract class HtmlElement
extends Object
implements HtmlPiece
    Html element.

    An html element has attributes. An attribute is a name-value pair. For example 

         HtmlElement input = new Html4.INPUT();
     input.setAttribute("id", "q");
     input.setAttribute("disabled", "");
     input.render(0, System.out::print); // <input id="q" disabled>

    For boolean attributes, use "" as true, null as false, for example 

         input.setAttribute("disabled", "");   // <input name="q" disabled>
     input.setAttribute("disabled", null); // <input name="q">  // not disabled

    This is an abstract class; a concrete subclass needs to implement getElementType().

    See HtmlParentElement for elements that can contain children.

    • Method Detail

      • getElementType

        public abstract HtmlElementType getElementType()
        Get the metadata of this element. See HtmlElementType.

      • isBlock

        public boolean isBlock()
        Whether this is a "block" element.

        This method is equivalent to `getElementType().isBlock`.

        Specified by:
        isBlock in interface HtmlPiece

      • getAttributeCount

        public int getAttributeCount()
        Get the number of attributes.

      • getAttribute

        public CharSequence getAttribute(String name)
        Get the value of the attribute; null if the attribute is not present.

      • setAttribute

        public CharSequence setAttribute(String name,
                                 CharSequence value)
        Set the value of the attribute.

        If `value` is null, the attribute is removed.

        The value can contain any chars. It can be empty.

        Returns:
        the previous value of the attribute, or null if the attribute didn't exist.

      • getAttributeMap

        public Map<String,CharSequence> getAttributeMap()
        Get a live Map view of the attributes.

        The returned Map supports read and write.

      • render

        public void render(int indent,
                   Consumer<CharSequence> out)
        Render this element to `out`.

        An example rendering: <input name="q" disabled>

        If an attribute value is empty, only the name is rendered. For example. 

         setAttribute("disabled", "")    ==>    <input disabled>

        Special chars in attribute values will be escaped, using HtmlPiece.renderEscaped(). For example 

         setAttribute("name", "a&b")     ==>    <input name="a&amp;b">
        Specified by:
        render in interface HtmlPiece
